- add a unit test covering rounded pcb cutout handling

title: Add source_pin_must_be_connected_error
description: Adds a new error type for when a pin with the mustBeConnected attribute is not connected to any trace.

title: add is_covered_with_solder_mask to pcb_hole and pcb_plated_hole
description: Adds an optional boolean property is_covered_with_solder_mask to various PCB hole types to indicate if they are covered with solder mask.

title: fix: add is_covered_with_solder_mask for pcb_plated_hole_circle
description: Adds an optional boolean field is_covered_with_solder_mask to the pcb_plated_hole_circle definition to indicate if the hole is covered with solder mask.

title: Added corner_radius to Pcb Cutout Rect
description: Adds an optional corner_radius property to the PcbCutoutRect type, allowing for rounded corners in PCB cutouts.

title: add `solder_mask_margin` to smptpads, hole and plated_hole
description: Adds an optional soldermask_margin property to SMT pads, holes, and plated holes in the PCB design schema.

title: Add pcbStraightLine trace prop
description: Adds an optional pcbStraightLine flag to trace props to request straight PCB routing, documents regenerated component definitions and prop overviews, and covers the new property with a unit test.
body:
## Summary
- add optional `pcbStraightLine` flag to trace props to request straight pcb routing
- document regenerated component definitions and prop overviews
- cover the new property with a unit test

## Testing
- bun test tests/trace.test.ts
- bunx tsc --noEmit

title: feat: Add panelization props
description: Adds props to the Panel component to support panelization methods like tab-routing.
body:
Adds props to the Panel component to support panelization methods like tab-routing.                               

New props:                                                                                                        

  panelizationMethod: "tab-routing" or "none"                                                                    
  boardGap                                                                                                       
  tabWidth                                                                                                       
  tabLength                                                                                                      
  mouseBites

title: add the solderMargin prop for `plated_hole`, `hole` and `pcb_smtpads`
description: Adds the solderMargin property to the CircleHoleProps, PillHoleProps, RectHoleProps, CirclePlatedHoleProps, OvalPlatedHoleProps, PillPlatedHoleProps, and various SMT pad properties to allow for customizable solder mask margins.

title: add coveredWithSolderMask to pcb_hole and pcb_plate_hole
description: Adds a coveredWithSolderMask property to pcb_hole and pcb_plate_hole interfaces to specify if holes are covered with solder mask.

title: Feat: Introduce mustBeConnected prop
description: Adds a mustBeConnected property to pin attributes, allowing for more precise control over pin connection requirements in circuit designs.

title: fix: norefdes - add flag for all footprints
description: Adds the norefdes flag to all footprints to disable reference designator labels, enhancing the flexibility of footprint definitions.
body: /closes #265 ### Summary I am updating all the other footprints to have the "noref" (has now been renamed to "norefdes") flag based on the merged PR that I authored https://github.com/tscircuit/footprinter/pull/389 ### Evidence Of Effective Result For each footprint that seemed to be able to use the "norefdes" flag, I added a new test file. There is just one test that is a copy of the test at the top of the original footprint test file, but this time with the norefdes flag added. These tests no longer exist due to the discussion below, but the screenshot and screen-recording still work as proof that it is working. screen-recording: [cinnamon-2025-11-18T170152-0800.webm](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a73bda72-17f5-43d4-a18f-a38e38f447e2)

title: Fix inner and outer diameter for dip
description: Fixes the inner and outer diameter values for DIP components in the footprint definitions.

title: Populate pin numbers on pads
description: Propagates numeric pin numbers to pcb_smtpad and pcb_plated_hole elements when port names are numeric, verifies that plated holes keep pin numbers, and adds a new SMD footprint regression covering pin_number on pads.
body:
## Summary
- propagate numeric pin numbers to pcb_smtpad and pcb_plated_hole elements when port names are numeric
- verify plated holes keep pin numbers and add a new SMD footprint regression covering pin_number on pads
- include a simple SMD footprint fixture for reuse in tests

## Testing
- bunx tsc --noEmit
- bun test tests/repros/repro02-promicro-port-hints.test.ts
- bun test tests/repros/repro03-smt-pin-number.test.ts
- bun run format

title: Add support for PcbHoleWithPolygonPad
description: Adds support for a new hole shape hole_with_polygon_pad in the PCB design, allowing for custom polygon-shaped pads in plated holes.

title: feat: add support for the `soldermask_margin` in smtpads, hole and plated holes
description: Add support for the soldermask_margin property in holes, plated holes, and SMT pads, allowing for more precise control over solder mask coverage.

title: fix: Disable panel auto-layout with explicit board positions
description: Disables the auto-layout feature for panels when any child board has explicit pcbX or pcbY coordinates, preventing unexpected layouts with mixed positioned boards.
body:
This change adjusts the panel's auto-layout feature to be disabled if any child board has explicit pcbX or pcbY   
coordinates.                                                                                                      

Previously, the auto-layout system would attempt to place any unpositioned boards, which could lead to unexpected 
layouts when mixed with manually positioned boards.                                                               

Now, the auto-layout and auto-sizing logic will only engage if all boards within the panel are unpositioned. If at
least one board has its position set manually, the auto-layout is skipped entirely.                               

A test case has been added to ensure that a panel with a mix of positioned and unpositioned boards correctly      
disables the auto-layout functionality.

title: feat: Implement automatic PCB panelization
description: This change implements automatic PCB panelization features for the panel component, enabling automatic arrangement of boards, generation of tabs and mouse bites, and dynamic resizing of the panel.
body:
This change introduces comprehensive panelization features for the <panel> component. It enables automatic        
arrangement of boards, generation of tabs and mouse bites, and dynamic resizing of the panel itself.              

Key features include:                                                                                             

  Automatic Grid Placement: Boards within a <panel> that lack explicit pcbX and pcbY coordinates are now         
   automatically arranged in a grid. The grid aims to be as square as possible (e.g., 4 boards form a 2x2 grid, 5 
   boards form a 3x2 grid).                                                                                       
  Intelligent Spacing: Boards in the grid are spaced by a distance equal to the TAB_DEPTH, creating the necessary
   gap for tabs.                                                                                                  
  Tab and Mouse Bite Generation: A new utility, generatePanelTabsAndMouseBites, automatically creates tabs and   
   corresponding mouse bites around the edges of all boards in the panel, including in the gaps between adjacent  
   boards. The logic correctly handles corner-to-corner tabbing.                                                  
  Panel Auto-Sizing: When auto-placement is used, the panel's overall dimensions are recalculated to be the      
   bounding box of the contained boards, plus a margin of TAB_DEPTH * 3 on all sides.                             
  New Tests: A dedicated test suite (panel-with-tabs.test.tsx) has been added with snapshot testing to validate  
   the placement and tab generation for various board configurations.

title: feat: Add schematic representation for VoltageProbes
description: Adds schematic representation for VoltageProbe components, including color-coded probes and automatic naming based on connection paths.
body:
This PR introduces a schematic representation for VoltageProbe components to provide better visual feedback for   
SPICE simulations.                                                                                                

Key changes:                                                                                                      

  Schematic Voltage Probes: The VoltageProbe component now creates a schematic_voltage_probe element, which is   
   rendered on the schematic at the connection point.                                                             
  Color-Coded Probes: Each probe is assigned a unique color from a palette. This color is used for both the      
   schematic symbol and the corresponding line in the simulation graphs, making it easy to see which line belongs 
   to which probe.                                                                                                
  New Utility: A getSimulationColorForId utility was added to manage the assignment of consistent colors to      
   probes.                                                                                                        
  Default Naming: Voltage probes now automatically generate a name from their connection path if an explicit name
   is not provided.                                                                                               
  Dependencies: Updated circuit-json, circuit-json-to-spice, spicey, and @tscircuit/ngspice-spice-engine.

title: feat(sot886): Implement SOT-886 component with example and snapshot test
description: Add SOT-886 component implementation with 6 terminals (3 per side) and create example file demonstrating SOT-886 usage with ExtrudedPads
body: - Add SOT-886 component implementation with 6 terminals (3 per side) - Create example file demonstrating SOT-886 usage with ExtrudedPads - Add snapshot test for SOT-886 component rendering - Update Footprinter3d to support sot886 footprint mapping Dimensions: bodyWidth: 1.0mm (D dimension) bodyLength: 1.45mm (E dimension) bodyHeight: 0.5mm (A dimension) terminalWidth: 0.2mm (b dimension) terminalLength: 0.3mm (L dimension) pitch: 0.5mm (e1 dimension) Test Snapshot

title: add support for `is_covered_with_solder_mask` for `pcb_hole` and `pcb_plated_hole`
description: Adds support for the is_covered_with_solder_mask property in pcb_hole and pcb_plated_hole, affecting how solder masks are rendered based on this property.

title: Add corner-radius support for rectangular PCB cutouts
description: Adds support for corner_radius on rectangular PCB cutouts, converting the radius into SVG rxry, scaling by the board transform, and ensuring compatibility with rotation. Includes updates to circuit-json and a snapshot test for verification.
body: Adds support for corner_radius on rectangular PCB cutouts. The radius is now converted into SVG rx/ry, scaled by the board transform, and works with rotation. Updated circuit-json and added a snapshot test to verify rounded and pill-shaped cutouts.

title: feat: add `soldermask_margin` support around `pcb_smtpads`
description: Adds support for soldermask_margin around SMT pads, allowing for customizable solder mask dimensions based on positive or negative margin values.

title: feat: add support for `soldermask_margin` for `pcb_hole` and `pcb_plated_hole`
description: Add support for soldermask margin in PCB hole and plated hole rendering, allowing for customizable soldermask dimensions based on the specified margin.

- add a gerber snapshot test covering rounded PCB cutouts

## Testing

title: feat: Implement off-board connection substitution
description: Implements a new routing optimization feature that uses off-board connections to find more efficient paths.
body:
Implements a new routing optimization feature that uses  connections to find more efficient paths.

When a connection is marked , its points are treated as electrically equivalent. The  now preprocesses these connections to create equivalence groups. When solving for an on-board connection, the solver can now substitute a target point with a closer, equivalent point from an off-board group, reducing the total trace length.

title: Standardize ccwFullOutline Naming Across Solvers + Add New Repro Case
description: Replaced all fullOutline params, fields, and references with ccwFullOutline. Updated all dependent solvers (LargestRectOutsideOutlineFromPointSolver, OutlineSegmentCandidatePointSolver, SingleComponentPackSolver). Synced all tests, debugger components, and example pages with the new API. Added repro11 showcasing a complex packing scenario to improve debugging coverage.
body:
Replaced all fullOutline params, fields, and references with ccwFullOutline.

Updated all dependent solvers (LargestRectOutsideOutlineFromPointSolver, OutlineSegmentCandidatePointSolver, SingleComponentPackSolver).

Synced all tests, debugger components, and example pages with the new API.

Added repro11 showcasing a complex packing scenario to improve debugging coverage.

title: feat: add support for BREP copper pours with bulge-to-arc conversion
description: Add support for rendering BREP (Boundary Representation) shaped copper pours, including proper handling of curved edges via bulge values.
body: ## Add Support for BREP Copper Pours with Bulge-to-Arc Conversion Fixes #76 ### Summary This PR adds support for rendering BREP (Boundary Representation) shaped copper pours, including proper handling of curved edges via bulge values. BREP shapes allow for complex copper pour geometries with outer boundaries and inner holes, where vertices can have bulge values that create arc segments instead of straight lines. ### Changes **New Utility: `lib/utils/brep-to-jscad.ts`** - Implements `convertBrepRingToPoints()` to convert BREP vertices with bulge values into interpolated point arrays - Handles bulge-to-arc conversion using standard DXF/CAD formulas where `bulge = tan(/4)` - Supports positive bulge (counterclockwise arcs) and negative bulge (clockwise arcs) - Includes `arePointsClockwise()` helper for proper polygon winding order **Updated: `lib/converters/circuit-to-3d.ts`** - Added BREP copper pour rendering support alongside existing rect and polygon shapes - Handles outer rings and inner rings (holes) with proper boolean subtraction - Added `renderCopperPoursAs3D` option (defaults to `false`) to control whether copper pours are rendered as 3D geometry or only in board textures - By default, copper pours render in board textures to avoid Z-fighting **Updated: `lib/types.ts`** - Added `renderCopperPoursAs3D?: boolean` option to `CircuitTo3DOptions` **New Test: `tests/snapshot/copper-pour-brep.test.ts`** - Comprehensive test covering various BREP scenarios: - Square with rounded-corner hole - Bulgy outer ring with multiple holes (square and triangular) - Circular pour (using bulge=1 for semicircles) - Bottom layer pour with rounded corner - Comparison with existing rect and polygon pours ### Technical Details The bulge conversion algorithm: 1. Calculates the included angle: ` = 4 atan(bulge)` 2. Computes arc radius and sagitta (arc height) 3. Finds arc center by offsetting from chord midpoint 4. Generates 32 interpolated points per radians for smooth curves 5. Handles proper sweep direction based on bulge sign ### Visual Results

title: Feat/brep texture only
description: This PR simplifies copper pour rendering by removing the 3D geometry approach and relying entirely on texture-based rendering via circuit-to-svg, eliminating Z-fighting issues and providing a more realistic PCB appearance.
body: ## Remove 3D Copper Pour Rendering, Use Texture-Only Approach ref #81 Fixes #76 ### Summary This PR simplifies copper pour rendering by removing the 3D geometry approach and relying entirely on texture-based rendering via `circuit-to-svg`. This eliminates Z-fighting issues and provides a more realistic PCB appearance. ### Changes - **Removed**: All 3D copper pour rendering code from `lib/converters/circuit-to-3d.ts` - Removed rect, polygon, and BREP 3D copper pour geometry generation - Removed `renderCopperPoursAs3D` option - **Deleted**: `lib/utils/brep-to-jscad.ts` utility (no longer needed) - **Updated**: `lib/types.ts` to remove `renderCopperPoursAs3D` option from both `ConversionOptions` and `CircuitTo3DOptions` ### Why This Approach? Copper pours are now rendered exclusively in board textures (via `circuit-to-svg`), which: - Eliminates Z-fighting between 3D copper geometry and board surface - Provides more realistic PCB appearance (copper as part of the board, not floating above it) - Simplifies the codebase by removing ~200 lines of 3D geometry code - Maintains full support for BREP shapes with bulge-to-arc conversion (handled by `circuit-to-svg`) ### Testing - All existing copper pour tests pass - BREP copper pour test passes with texture rendering - Visual snapshots updated showing improved appearance

title: refactor: panel mesh into separate file
description: Refactors the panel mesh functionality by moving it into a separate file for better organization and maintainability.

title: Support pcb_panel in gltf
description: Adds support for rendering PCB panels in GLTF format, including handling of panel dimensions, textures, and integration with existing PCB board structures.

title: Add silkscreen to XiaoReceiver
description: Adds silkscreen paths to the XiaoReceiver component for better visual representation on the PCB.

title: XiaoReceiver now actually moves around with pcbX and pcbY
description: Fixes the positioning of the XiaoReceiver component by allowing it to move according to pcbX and pcbY parameters instead of being fixed at (0,0).

title: Refine XiaoReceiver
description: Refines the XiaoReceiver component by marking pin labels as a const map for stronger literal inference and typing XiaoReceiver props with ChipProps to validate connections.
body:
## Summary
- mark XiaoReceiver pin labels as a const map for stronger literal inference
- type XiaoReceiver props with ChipProps<typeof PIN_LABELS> so connections are validated

## Testing
- bunx tsc --noEmit
- bun run format

title: feat: Preserve net name casing from SPICE string
description: Preserves the casing of net names specified in the .print tran command of the SPICE string in the final output voltage graphs.
body:
This change ensures that the net name casing specified in the .print tran       
command of the SPICE string is preserved in the final output voltage graphs.    

The logic for extracting requested plots now stores the original casing from the
SPICE string. When generating the voltage graphs, this original casing is used  
for the netName, even if the simulation engine returns a different case. A test 
has been added to verify this behavior.

title: Added bugreport 11

description: Adds formatting scripts to the project for consistent code style enforcement using biome.

- **PrimList fix**

title: Fix two tests causing CI test failure
description: Fixes snapshot conflicts in CI tests by splitting tests into separate files to ensure unique snapshot names.
body:
The basics17-from-scratch.test.ts file had 2 tests, but bun-match-svg generates snapshot names based on the file path, causing both tests to share the same snapshot file. This led to snapshot conflicts where one test would overwrite the other's snapshot, causing failures on CI.

Changes:
- Split the second test into basics18-from-scratch-curves.test.ts
- Updated basics17 snapshot to match the square path test
- Created basics18 snapshot for the curved path test

This follows the existing pattern where each test file contains only one test, ensuring each snapshot is unique.

title: Set origin from circuit-json bounds automatically
description: Automatically calculates the bounding box of all circuit elements and sets the origin to ensure all elements are positioned in the positive quadrant (x  0, y  0) to prevent elements from being cut off in the LightBurn work area.
body:
drant

When no origin is provided, automatically calculates the bounding box of all circuit elements and sets the origin to ensure all elements are positioned in the positive quadrant (x >= 0, y >= 0). This prevents elements from being cut off in the LightBurn work area which only supports positive coordinates.

- Added calculateBounds.ts with functions to compute circuit bounds
- Modified main conversion to auto-calculate origin when not explicitly provided
- Maintains backward compatibility: explicit origin values are still respected

title: Add optional origin parameter to configuration
description: Add optional origin parameter x: number, y: number to function options, include origin in ConvertContext for use across all handlers, and apply origin offset in addRectSmtPad and addPcbTrace handlers when creating Box geometry and circle centers respectively, defaulting origin to x: 0, y: 0 if not provided.
body:
- Add optional origin parameter {x: number, y: number} to function options
- Include origin in ConvertContext for use across all handlers
- Apply origin offset in addRectSmtPad handler when creating Box geometry
- Apply origin offset in addPcbTrace handler for circle centers and segment centers
- Default origin to {x: 0, y: 0} if not provided

title: Boolean Geometry System, LGA Interconnect Test Now Working
description: This pull request introduces a Boolean geometry system for handling PCB traces and SMT pads, enhancing the connectivity mapping and geometry generation for circuit designs. It includes new functionalities for converting circles to polygons, managing connectivity maps, and unifying geometries for better representation in the LightBurn project.
